ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: n this role, you will be a part of the RFIC design team responsible for providing RF solutions for wireless chips.

ul.li: • Typically requires 7+ years of analog and mixed signal design experience, including 5+ years of high-speed ADC or DAC design.
• Demonstrated track record for bringing high-speed Analog/Mixed-Signal designs into high volume production.
• Good understanding of device noise, mismatch, linearity and device and layout parasitics.
• Extensive experience in Si characterization and debug of high-speed analog blocks.
• Experience with custom high-speed digital design and custom timing preferred.
• Ability to drive strong production test/QA methodologies.

div.p: • Design high-speed analog/digital data converters (ADC and DAC). • Work with the platform architects and system groups to refine relevant analog specs from power/performance tradeoffs. • Work with the digital design team to define digital interfaces and constraints for analog/digital integration of high-speed data converters. • Drive floorplan and layout toward successful tape-out using best-practice layout techniques. • Work with the chip team to successfully integrate analog IP at chip level. • Define and run top-level verification and modeling of analog IPs. • Define bench bring-up and test plans and validate/characterize/debug designs into high volume production.
